comments.comment: What is the useful life of the laser in hours? If the laser inside the unit dies, will parts be available for an easy replacement by home users?
Hi Khalid

Currently, the lifetime testing of the lasers used in the X1/X1 Pro is still ongoing. The 5000 hours of testing data has shown that the power degradation remains within 5%. According to the lifetime model provided by Coherent scientists, with operation at our calibrated environment temperature (<40℃), the expected lifetime of the laser will reach 15,000 hours. Our reliability laboratory will continue to update the laser’s operational lifetime data. Of course, we welcome you to join us in testing this data, and if needed, we can recommend the necessary testing equipment.

As for consumables like protective lenses, users can easily replace them themselves. After the campaign ends, you can still purchase the required consumables on our official website, and they are very easy to obtain.

If the laser inside the machine fails, for your safety, we recommend that you can do it if you have a professional background in laser usage. Otherwise, we suggest you have a professional do the replacement.
Thank you
Do you have a list (or pictures) of some of the settings that most likely will be available?
As if I want to throttle the output down if the emitter got over certain temperature, just for example.
Or just different output modes and stuff.
That would be nice!
Hi Johnny
We previously created a suggested settings table and posted it in our Facebook group. You can check it out here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1364101664569892/posts/1413724449607613.
Does this have the information you’re looking for?
Thank you
The settings available in the menus, what is there you can adjust more than power, frequency and width?
Hi Johnny
The X1 Pro menu allows adjustments for wire feeding speed, pulse width, language, etc. A brief introduction to this can be found at the 3:03 mark in Samiluo’s YouTube video on our Kickstarter page.
For X1, only power, pulse width, and time interval can be adjusted.
Our user manual will provide detailed instructions, so please stay tuned for its release.
Thank you for your patience!
A question which may have been answered somewhere in the comments, but if it has, I can't find it:

Given the US's currently wildly fluctuating tariffs and threats of tariffs on imports from China, is the price + shipping on this stable, or is it subject to change if/when the individual in the White House makes up his mind?
Hi Jean

Regarding the recently announced tariff increase policy in the United States, we are closely monitoring and assessing its impact on costs. Currently, we are working hard to find a balance between not adding extra costs for our users and ensuring the sustainable operation of the company. We are also in communication with logistics companies to explore suitable solutions.

The profit margin for the products in this Kickstarter campaign is very slim, and the instability of U.S. policies has posed a significant challenge for us. The uncertainty of future policies under the Trump administration is also unpredictable. We are committed to facing all backers with the utmost sincerity, and we are willing to bear any reasonable increase in costs. if the repeated policy changes result in costs that we cannot bear, we will communicate with you, and you can continue to stay updated with our activities.
Thank you for your understanding.
Thanks so much.
You're welcome～
Hi! Two questions:
1. Can Pro version do laser beam wobbling during welding (to distribute heat when welding thin materials)?
2. Which is international customs code of the Laser Welder Machine? Just to double check whether there may be any obstacles at EU customs when importing a class 4 laser device.
Thanks!
Hi Kalle
1.X1 Pro supports laser beam wobbling welding function.

2.The customs code for both of our laser welders is 8515809090. However, please note that the customs code for the same type of product may differ depending on the country. Therefore, when importing to different countries or regions, the specific customs code may vary.
Thank you

DIY talk about communication with the laser has opened up more questions about how the laser is controlled.

Does the network interface control settings only or does it operate the laser as well? Is there also a serial interface? What about switch the laser on and off? Is that part of an interface? or does that require us to modify the existing laser hardware.
I would like clarification on this as on/off timing is important in an automated set up. Doing this via network obviously creates a unnecessary level of variance in the timing.
Hi Erwin
The network interface can directly control the laser, but this function is primarily used for internal testing before shipment and is not open for CNC functionality.

If you are interested, you can check out “Hacksmith Industries” video for exploration. However, enabling this feature requires time to address a series of issues, especially safety concerns arising from non-professional use. The X1 Pro can cut through 3mm stainless steel, and safety is always our top priority—we must ensure the protection of every one of our backers.
If you are interested, you can contact our R&D engineers for a special discussion!
Hi Erwin
The network interface can directly control the laser, but this function is primarily used for internal testing before shipment and is not open for CNC functionality.

If you are interested, you can check out “Hacksmith Industries” video for exploration. However, enabling this feature requires time to address a series of issues, especially safety concerns arising from non-professional use. The X1 Pro can cut through 3mm stainless steel, and safety is always our top priority—we must ensure the protection of every one of our backers.
If you are interested, you can contact our R&D engineers for a special discussion!

Hi Z

✨ Thank you for your suggestions—we hear you! When setting our Stretch Goals, we focused on the welding work environment. Welding is a tough job that requires dust protection and frequent hydration, so we carefully chose rewards that reflect these needs. More importantly, we hoped these rewards would serve as a special reminder of this exciting journey we've shared together. 💙That said, we've passed along your suggestions to the team, and they are giving them serious consideration! 💡

As for the warranty, while our page states a one-year warranty, in reality, if your machine encounters any issues, you can reach out to us anytime, and we will do our best to provide support. Your satisfaction is our priority! 🔧
Additionally, we’re planning an exclusive discount coupon for all our amazing backers on our official website! 💌 Stay tuned—we’ll share more details as soon as it's ready!
Once again, thank you for your support and feedback. Together, we're making this project even better!🙌

Could you briefly explain the difference for the types of lenses? I'm interested in adding some to my pledge, but would like to know better the difference between them and pros and cons, please.
Hi Gabriel
The laser protective lens is designed to prevent dust and splashes from damaging the focusing lens, making it an essential consumable part. It is typically made of quartz with a coated surface.
The focusing lens concentrates parallel light beams into a high-energy density point to achieve a powerful laser beam. It is usually a convex lens made of quartz or silicon.
The collimating lens shapes divergent light into a parallel beam, optimizing beam quality. It is generally made of quartz or crystal.
Thank you

Have the units a PFC build in? What is the life time of the Fiber Laser in real condition because it gets hot in the inside of the Unit?
Hi Great1OAk
After the campaign ends, you will be able to purchase the necessary consumables from our official store.
Thank you
1: Does they not have different laser sources, should not one of them be better?
2: Same + does it mean that after 5k hours 95% output power remains?
3: phase-change cooling? when and how is this used?
Hi Johnny

1.The X1 Pro uses a fiber laser, while the X1 uses a semiconductor laser. These two types of lasers are designed for different usage environments and requirements, and their principles are different. There’s no definitive answer as to which one is better.

2.Our aging tests are based on data collected from regular usage, and the stability of our lasers is unquestionable. Due to the high reliability of COHERENT chips, this data is accurate. After 5000 hours of use, the device’s power can still reach 95%.
3.Phase-change cooling actually refers to the air cooling technology used in our product.
We hope our response has addressed your questions.Thank you

Congratulations on ordering over 1000 devices here on Kickstarter.

Unfortunately, I have little knowledge about lasers and safety. Eye protection is particularly important. I assume that the laser safety glasses cannot withstand a direct laser beam of 700W. But what maximum power of a reflected laser beam should you expect in the worst case? What value do you assume there?
In the worst case scenario, can the laser safety glasses block this reflected beam and protect the eyes and if so, for how long?
Hi

The light reflection from laser welding does not directly enter the safety glasses. The purpose of the laser protective eyewear is to prevent damage from the brightness of the laser on the workpiece and any splashes during welding. The laser safety glasses we provide have a protection level of OD7, with a light-blocking effect of 10^-7, fully meeting the laser protection standards of various countries. Therefore, as long as you wear the safety glasses correctly during the operation of the equipment, there will be no harm to your eyes. I hope this answer addresses your question. If anything is unclear, feel free to ask us anytime!
Thank you
Are the culminating and focusing lens available as an add-on because they are considered consumable items for the X1Pro, if not why what are they used for?
Hi Z

The focusing lens and collimating lens are available as add-ons and are considered consumables. However, with proper usage, they typically do not wear out quickly—usually requiring replacement every six months to a year. But if the welding gun is accidentally dropped, they may get damaged immediately.

The main function of the focusing lens is to focus the laser beam onto a specific working area, concentrating the laser energy at the welding point. By precisely focusing the laser, welding accuracy and efficiency can be improved.

The role of the collimating lens in the laser welding gun is to convert the divergent laser beam into a parallel beam, reducing the divergence during beam propagation. The collimating lens optimizes the laser beam quality, which benefits subsequent focusing and energy transfer.
Thank you
Okay thanks, that helped
So do the protective lenses help increase the life of both the focusing and collimating lenses or are they just for one of the other?
Hi Z
You can think of it as protecting both because the same light passes through all three lenses.
Thank you

Hi. I would like to hear a confirmation from xphotonics that the recently announced increase of 20% tariffs over products imported from China to USA will NOT affect the final price of the X1 pro, meaning that xphotonics will cover this additional cost and will not add any extra fee to the buyers.
Thank you.
Wow I’m truly impressed!
Thank you xphotonics!
Thank you for the prompt and clear answer ! 👍
You’re welcome! If you have any further questions, feel free to leave us a message anytime.
Hi Navid

Based on our bodywork cleaning tests, the maximum width of our cleaning mode is 17mm. On the other hand, because the X1 Pro uses a heat fusion principle during cleaning, the paint on the sheet metal carbonizes and releases a large amount of dust, which is more effective on the metal surface. This is a limitation based on materials. Some specific coatings, such as high-temperature cured oxide layers, are difficult to remove. The third limitation is the cleaning depth. If the corrosion is too deep, repeated cleaning or mechanical grinding may be needed during use.
Thank you
How deep is too deep?
Hi Monday
The cleaning effect and depth vary depending on the material and surface condition, so we cannot provide a specific cleaning depth.
Thank you

I have made my pledge for an X1-Pro bundle and looking forward to you fulfilling this in the coming months. With the X1-Pro, is it possible to not use the wire feeder and to add material manually, like you do with TIG welding? Seeing some of the videos, the ability to remove the wire before the laser is stopped could be a better way to ensure a clean start and finish to the welds.
Hi Christopher

Thank you for your support! If you are an experienced welder, you can choose not to use the wire feeder and instead manually feed the wire to fill the weld. but, we will still equip you with a wire feeder. The purpose of including the wire feeder is to help more welding enthusiasts achieve cleaner, more beautiful welds. Please note that regardless of whether you use the wire feeder, always use the same type of wire as the welding material.
Thank you
